history.content:
Enroll in an extra class and just drop it once you add the Decal units

----

I believe they only care about the unit minimum after the add/drop deadline, so you should be fine
Enroll in an extra class and just drop it once you add the Decal units

There is no reason you couldn't be able to sign up for facilitation units for a decal you taught earlier -- it would just require the facilitation team being well-organized and asking the department enrollment manager where the decal is sponsored for the class # of the appropriate section earlier than normally happens.

I am currently planning out my schedule for next semester, thinking of doing CS61C, CS170, and ME 191K.

This only puts me at 11 units, but I am a facilitator for a DeCal and get 2 units for doing that.

Is there a way to get these units on my schedule before the start of the semester so I don't get flagged for having too few units?

Basically I am definitely going to be enrolled in more than 11 units during the semester, but I can't sign up for a few of these units until a few weeks into the semester (just based on the way that DeCals work).

Am I SOL? Or is this something I can work around?
history.subject: A little confused about 12 unit minimum (and it's relation to DeCal Units)...
